summary: This is an email exchange from March 1, 2019, between Stacie B. Harris of the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG) and two supervisors from the Public Corruption Unit of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY). The SDNY supervisors are reaching out to connect regarding the office's Epstein investigation, indicating coordination between Main Justice and the SDNY on the case.

persons.name: Stacie B. Harris
persons.role: Attorney, Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG)
persons.context: Recipient of an email from SDNY prosecutors; she responds to schedule a phone call regarding the Epstein investigation.

events.title: SDNY Prosecutors Reach Out to Main Justice
events.description: Two supervisors from the SDNY Public Corruption Unit email Stacie B. Harris at the Office of the Deputy Attorney General to introduce themselves and request a call regarding the SDNY's Epstein investigation.

events.title: Scheduling Call on Epstein Investigation
events.description: Stacie B. Harris responds to the SDNY prosecutors, offering to have a phone call later that day (around 1:30/2 p.m.) to connect regarding the Epstein case.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) had an active Epstein investigation as of February/March 2019, overseen by its Public Corruption Unit.
Main Justice, specifically the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG), was being contacted by SDNY prosecutors for coordination on the Epstein case.
The email indicates high-level internal DOJ communication and coordination regarding the Epstein investigation between different offices.
